stem: Given question: Luke was a human. Like most humans, he learned from his parents.  He was mortal, but he could preserve himself by doing what? and answer: write, explain why in
no_more_50_words: People often consider writings to be a way to preserve one's history. People can live on in the memories of future people reading the words they wrote.
100_to_150_words: Luke could preserve himself by writing his thoughts, experiences, and lessons in a journal or diary. Writing allows us to reflect on the past and share our memories with the future. By writing, Luke would be able to leave a record of his life that can be used for many generations to come. By writing, Luke could capture his wisdom, values, and teachings, and have them read by others. He could also share stories and advice with his family, friends, and even strangers. Writing is a powerful way to immortalize ourselves and leave a lasting legacy. It can help us to make sense of our lives and understand our purpose in life. Writing also allows us to share our thoughts and feelings with others, even after we are gone. Writing is a way for Luke to keep himself alive, even after he is gone.
